name: UNSMOKED RADICE Twin Bore Silk Cut Italian Billiard w Sweet Green Mother of Pearl Stem
description:
Wow.  THIS is a Christmas pipe.  The only thing that could make it more Christmas would be if it had a Red Rubino finish to go along with this fantastic Green Stem.  BUT, I happen to think the Tanshell Blast of Radice's Silk Cut pipes looks better.  Just look at those Gnarly ring-grains of blast that climb the bowl, all the way to the Birdseye Rim.

You will enjoy smoking this pipe just as much as looking at it, and if you've ever had a Radice before, you KNOW it's going to smoke like a champ.  One of my Radice's is a Twin Bore, and it is my Go To pipe for flakes.  This pipe is a good Group 5 in size and bowl capacity.  Definitely good for a 2-Hour smoke, depending on your puffing.

name: 1960's SOBORG Danish Hand Made Blasted Calabash Bulldog Estate Pipe**Barely smoked and MINT
description:
Another pipe from the 1960's Brooklyn collection.
 
SOBORG pipes were believed to be made by SÃ¸ren Refbjerg Rasmussen, beginning in the late 1960's.  He was never one of the really famous Great Danes, but his pipes are known for being great smokers.
This one has the look and feel of a Former-Eltang pipe, at a fraction of even their great prices.

So here's a rare opportunity to break one in from the beginning.  IF this pipe was ever smoked, it was 2 times or less, and 40+ years ago.  It required no cleaning, just the buffing of the stem and military mount.  
I totally dig this shape as well.  Definitely a Danish take on both the Calabash and the Bent Bulldog.  Nice size as well.  A Group 5 bowl capacity.

-Wide Open Draw
-takes a cleaner down to the bowl with a tweak.
-Sweet Military Mount vulcanite stem, w No Tooth Marks whatsoever.
-Feels great in the hand, or hangs perfectly tom the mouth.
-Crisp Edges w/ a Perfect Bowl Interior and Drilling

Markings:

HAND CARVED
MADE IN DENMARK
5

name: Flawless Jorgen L. Larsen D Grade Straight Grain Danish Rhodesian Dublin Estate Pipe
description:
Over the next few weeks I'll be listing pipes  from my personal collection to pay the Holiday bills.  

Obviously I have no idea what to call this shape.  But I do know what to call this pipe: Marvelous.  This pipe runs neck and neck with the Tonni Nielsen for my finest pipe.  Jorgen Larsen headed up the Jarl factory while hand-crafting about 100 pipes a year for his own Jorgen L. line, as well as the High Grade Peter Stokkebye pipes.  Jorgen is no longer making pipes as he developed, for the second time, an allergy to briar dust.  When he was making them regularly his grades ran from the top "A" down to about "M". 
Find out more about him HERE:
http://www.rdfield.com/Jorgen%20L/jorgen_l.htm

The attention to detail, the quality of the Straight Grain, the Balance and Feel--all combine to make this pipe a superb smoking instrument.  

It has been a dynamite smoker from the very first bowl.  In the year I have owned this pipe since purchasing it new, it has been smoked less than 15 times.  It never really needed breaking in, so it's just going to rock from the beginning for you, the way it has for me.  I have only smoked quality Virginia Tobaccos.

Big Bowl Capacity w a Deep Danish chamber.
Wide Open Draw
Comes with the original Jorgen L. leather pouch.
Perfect Drilling
Near Mint in all respects

Markings:
Jorgen L.
MADE IN DENMARK
D

Measurements:
6.1" long
2.4" tall bowl
1.75" deep bowl
.75" wide bowl

Here we have a barely-smoked (2x or less) Svendborg Danish Brandy. This pipe is Danish Modern like crazy.  Awesome Grain, Clean Lines, and Crisp Edges.  Actually sits up nicely too.

name: Vintage DUNHILL Black Leather Zipper Tobacco Pouch in Excellent Condition
description:
Say what you want about Dunhill's Luxury Men's goods being over-priced, because you're right, they are.  However, sometimes they just had really good ideas.  Like the leather tabs on the side of this Tobacco Pouch.  What in the world are those for?  Well, they are for your other hand to hold on to while you zip or unzip the pouch, so that you don't have to maul your precious tobacco within.  Ingenious.

This pouch is in Excellent Condition and has a rubberized lining to keep your tobacco fresher, longer.

5.8" wide
3.75" tall

This lovat is exceptionally light, has a great blast, and I really dig the smooth-rim contrast.

description:

What is really nice here is the Beautiful, contrast Flame Grain all around the bowl.  Also, the design is good, and makes for perfect clenching.

name: HUGE 1960's UNSMOKED PETERSON'S IRISH SECONDS Virgin Calabash Estate Pipe
description:
This pipe comes from a 1960's collection of pipes in Brooklyn, New York.  

Here's something you just don't see every day, at least in this combination.  First of all, a Peterson this big.  Second, one this old that hasn't been smoked.  Third, I'm not seeing any fills here. I see  several sand pits (and I guess that's the difference between Peterson now and back in the day--the pits back then render them a "second".  Now this would be a Sherlock at least.  Fourth, some Dynamite Birdseye on both sides of the bowl here.

You will not regret getting this pipe.  It is a winner.
-Wide Open Draw
-No tooth marks whatsoever on the vulcanite stem.
-Does not pass the cleaner test
-Crisp Edges all around
-Awesome, natural virgin finish

-Fantastic drilling, to the bottom of the chamber.

I'll get to the point: It may be called a Natural Vergin, but this is a Man's Pipe.  At times, it has been too Manly for me.  Just look at that sweet profile and its Art Deco coolness. name: Awesome Tonni Nielsen Nautilus Snail Estate Pipe *Near Mint
description:
Do you remember that girl that you didn't even try very hard to make out with because you were so smitten that it was enough just to hold her hand?  That is this pipe. I've never enjoyed just holding a pipe as much as I do this one. When I first picked it up I held it in my palm and it just sat there, upright and perfectly balanced, like a bird, chirping at me. 

I secured this pipe in a trade with a guy from the Viking Pipe Club of Saint Louis a few months back.  He bought it from Tonni himself a few years ago.  This might be the finest modern pipe I will ever own.  

What makes it is the shape.  There are lots of debates out there about who the best carver of modern pipes is and Tonni's name should always be in the conversation because of pipes like this.

-Wide Open Draw
-Perfect Drilling and Bowl interior
-Hand-Cut Ebonite, Oh-So-Comfortable Stem and Bit

name: BIG and Beautiful SAVINELLI Punto Oro 320 EX Blasted Author Banker Estate Pipe
description:
Savinelli definitely began by emulating the classic British pipe shapes.  But over the years, not only did they develop their own distinct Italian flair in their shapes, but they came up with a few classics of their own.  

The 320 is one of these--Savinelli's Author/Banker shape, and one of my favorites of all time.  Over the years I've owned several and they always deliver a delicious smoke.  

I have never owned one quite this big, that is, in the EX range.  This is a serious pipe; a Man's pipe--and made for long conversations and hard thinking for 2-3 hours at a time.  Feels great in the hand, which is good because you wouldn't want to clench it!
-Wide Open Draw

name: Unique Jobey Virgin Prima Extra Tear Drop Chubby Estate Pipe w Hand Cut Stem
description:
Originally I thought this was a "Jolly Boy" pipe.  But apparently, that's not the case.  Anyway, there's no way this one got asked out to prom, unless it was a cousin.  

Not that the condition isn't great, because it is Excellent.  Especially if you consider that this pipe is at LEAST from as far back as the 1950's and probably more.  I believe it was made in England because it has the same great hand-cut stems as the other English Jobey Pipes on the site, and it's from the same collector.  

The weirdness here is this shape.  The only thing that comes close is one of those Bilbo tear drop pipes made by Cavicci a few years back.  Or maybe a Hawkbill?
In any case:
-Wide Open Draw
-No toothmarks on the Original, Hand Cut Vulcanite Stem.  Tenon is slightly worn, but original.  Stem fits perfectly.
-Very nice Flame Grain and no fills that I can see
-Despite it's weirdness, the bowl does feel remarkably nice in the hand and, despite the large chubbiness of the bowl, you can actually clench it a bit.  Big bowl capacity too.
-The drilling is actually SPOT ON the bottom of the bowl, though I don't think you'll be passing the cleaner test with the stem on.
-Excellent Bowl Interior and Clean and Ready to smoke and Enjoy!

Markings:
Jobey

EXTRA

name: Vintage Loewe & Co. Standard Molesworth Billiard Estate Pipe w/ Great Grain
description:
Loewe and Company pipes were one of the legendary Upper Middle Class English Pipe Houses of the last 100 years that inevitably bowed to the Cadogan Empire.  But if you can find a pipe made before that, you've got a winner.
Based on this article (and my own two eyes), I believe we have a winner here.
http://pipedia.org/wiki/Loewe_%26_Co.

This pipe was owned by a buddy of mine in the Viking Pipe Club of Saint Louis that once had over 300 pipes and is now winnowing them down to a more manageable size.  Like the Castello I posted earlier, any flaws here are cosmetic and will not distract from what's sure to be incredible smoking.
The Good:
-Classic English Billiard Shaping
-Wide Open Draw
-Perfect Drilling
-Great, clean bowl interior
-Original Stem
-Fantastic, diagonal Flame Grain all around

The Unfortunate:
-Buffed Button w/ some tooth indentations (but nothing in danger of breaking through--it's too big to try and clench anyway)
-Some oxidation around the logo as I was trying to prevent wearing it away.
-The markings are light  (but still readable).
-Rim has some scuffs

name: BIG CASTELLO Old Antiquari (Sea Rock) K223 Hand Made Estate Pipe *Carlo Scotti
description:
For all the MOST important things, this Castello has it going on:  Nice, big capacity, Wide Open Draw, Perfect Drilling, Excellent Bowl Interior, Clean>>All Checks!

However, this pipe has been smoked and enjoyed and you can tell.  No cracks or real damage mind you.  But the rim is a bit rough and scratched on one edge (not too big of a deal on an Old Antiquari).  And the thing some of you will care about, and some will think an improvement, is that the original stem, which would have had a rhinestone embedded into the side, is absent.  Instead e have a replacement stem that works fine and quite possibly has a more open draw than the rhinestone stems sometimes did.  I believe the replacement is lucite.

Here's something weird, but I think I've seen it before:  This is one of those pipes that's clearly a Sea Rock (rusticated) finish from Castello, and yet it is labeled an Old Antiquari (sandblasted) finish.  I don't know why, but I'm sure there's some Castello Aficionados that can enlighten me. 

Also, it's labelled K223, but it is definitely NOT a single "K" size.  The bowl easily takes my thumb, and check out the rest of the dimensions.  It is easily a KKKK and maybe more in capacity.  Weird.

Markings:

name: 1960's BRAKNER Bella Danica Antique Hand Cut 604 Danish Bulldog Estate Pipe
description:
This one pains me.  Once upon a time I was a huge collector of all pipes old and Danish.  Two changes have occurred to lead me to sell this beautiful pipe:  1)  I now collect all pipes old and British.  2) My wife is having our second child in a few weeks and we need baby stuff again.

Brakner pipes are a rare treat that I only occasionally see at Pipe shows.  At any given time I've seen a maximum of 3 of them on eBay.  This one has been a faithful friend for a couple of years, but now the time is right to pass it on to someone who will smoke it more than this guy.

Peter Brakner was trained in the Suhr workshop and created great pipes alongside some of the greats.  He was especially known for 3 things:
1) a guy smoking a Brakner pipe won the world slow-smoking competition in 1955.
2) he did FANTASTIC stem work, as you can see here.
3) his micro-rustication Antique finish,  which feels great and keeps things cool.  No one knew the secret of how he did this finish except Kai Nielsen's mother.  Really.  

The Bella Danica pipes were rare shapes of a larger size than your average Brakner.
-Great shaping here.  A classic Tall Danish Bulldog
-Wide Open Draw
-Perfect Drilling
-Excellent chamber and just a tiny amount of inner-rim wear.
-Beautiful, Hand Cut Ebonite stem has No Toothmarks Whatsoever.
-Feels FANTASTIC in the hand with the shaping and antique finish.
-From my personal collection.  Very clean and fully restored and ready to enjoy by you.

Markings:
BRAKNER ANTIQUE
BELLA DANICA
HAND-CUT
DENMARK
604

name: Early 1960's Barling Transition 6279 Pot Billiard TVF Estate Pipe
description:
This is one of the last pipes I have from the collection of a man who worked at Smokers Haven from the 1950's until the 1970's.  The collection included a lot of quality Freehands and GBDs, but by far, this pot billiard must have been his favorite shape because he had 4 of these 6279s and a very similar GBD as well.  And from all appearances, these pot billiards were the pipes he really liked to smoke.  

Of all of the pots, this one Barling survived the most in-tact.  From what I have read, this was an unusual shape.
-The Bowl is perfectly drilled and in EXCELLENT condition with no pits or spider-webbing.
-The Rim is also in Excellent condition, with slightly rounded edges from years of enjoyment, but no real wear, or darkening or scorching.
-The grain is similar to a Dunhill Bruyere, both in finish and in grain quality.  1/2 of it is Flame Grain while the other half is Birdseye and swirling grain.  There are NO FILLs that I can detect.  It certainly appears to be of the same quality as my pre-transition Barling, but since I only have one, I am by no means an expert.

-The nomenclature is very faint, though I can make out
Barling (in script)
6279 TVF
LONDON ENGLAND
-The draw is WIDE OPEN and I believe the stem is original.  I'm not sure why you would try to clench it, but the original owner did at times and left it with a few tooth indentations, though nothing in danger of breaking through, especially if you treat it right.
-No cracks pits, or fills that I can detect.

This Pipe has been fully restored and is ready to smoke and enjoy.

1.6" tall bowl
1.2" deep bowl
1.1" wide bowl

name: Stunning Seven 7 Day Set of Jost's Olde English Estate Pipes by Comoy's
description:
Wow. I am so excited to be able to offer this 7 Day set of Jost's pipes.

Jost's was a legendary shop in Downtown Saint Louis that closed in the early 1980's.  They had a handmade pipe maker named Harvey Raspberry in house.  But the pipes I see from them the most were made by Comoy's from the 1950's through the 1970's.  Comoy's provided several lines to Jost's, and at the top was the Olde English Supreme.  

From a collector's standpoint, these are the best that Comoy's would send.  They usually featured beautiful contrast grain, like the Blue Riband line, but with more Cross-Grain/Birdseye patterns rather than vertical Straight Grain.

All of these pipes are in Near Mint to Excellent Condition.  The stems have been buffed and polished so there are No Toothmarks whatsoever.  The Bowl interiors are excellent and none have been smoked very much.  The drilling is perfect in each and every one, and all of the draws are wide open.

name: Stunning KAI NIELSEN Bent Billiard Pipe with Cumberland Stem * Barely Smoked
description:
Kai Nielsen Pipes are known for being some of the most beautiful out there.  He and his father Viggo produced their own pipes, along with running the Bari pipe factory during the years it produced pipes that beat Stanwell all to hell.

This is the first Kai Nielsen Pipe I've ever had the pleasure of handling.  I am very, very impressed.  At first glance this is just your basic Bent Billiard.  
 
But then you see that the shank/bowl handoff is just awesome, coming slightly underneath the bowl like a big scoop, or a hand cradling the bowl from underneath--a hand absolutely silly with perfectly centered Birdseye that explodes up the sides of the bowl into perfect straight grain all around.  This is all brought out perfectly by the red/orange contrast stain that Kai Nielsen uses a lot--and pairs up nicely with the cumberland stem that is oh-so-thin and comfortable.

Speaking of comfortable, this pipe could teach the world lessons on balance.  When you cradle it in your hand, the stem is naturally in the right spot to enter your mouth.  

The walls of this pipe are quite thick and the drilling is perfectly centered on the bottom of the bowl.  This is going to mean a cool, dry smoke for you.

In addition, from what I understand, this is a good-sized pipe for Kai.  It is at least a Group 4 in the Dunhill way of thinking and that means it's bigger than most of his pipes tend to be.

The sniff test reveals that this has been smoked VERY little, and so little that I can't detect what type of tobacco was enjoyed previously.

The only thing I could think of you might complain about is that, like so many of Kai's pipes, this one IS drilled for a 9mm filter.  I wouldn't use one if I were you--I wouldn't even use an adaptor.  I would just light up and enjoy the open draw.

Oh, there's one other thing too and that's that the only stamping on this is the Kai Nielsen signature itself.  This means that I'm flying blind here on how I should price this pipe.  Judging from the research I can find on the net, this pipe is AT LEAST a VVV (or B for the Euro market) but it may be a VVVV or an A OR IT COULD BE A JEWEL OF DENMARK (his highest grade).  You will need to judge for yourself.  I'm going to price it as if it were a VVV and you are probably going to make out like a bandit.

Markings:

Otherwise, the condition is Excellent ++ with no tooth marks whatsoever, a wide open draw, perfect drilling, and exceedingly crisp edges.

description:
This pouch has no interior lining, only a velcro enclosure.  So alone, it will keep your tobacco about as fresh as rolling it up inside your T-shirt.  
I recommend pairing it with a plastic baggie on the inside.  

I won't tell anyone.

No Markings

name: Vintage B Jacobson of Stockholm Billiard Estate Pipe
description:
Here's a nice, vintage briar, again from a company on whom I could find very little information.  

But I do have eyes and this is a lovely-grained and well-constructed pipe with Great Birdseye and Cross Grain.  The only knocks on this pipe are a couple of dings on the rim (otherwise crisp edges there), some minor inner rim darkening, and a single tooth mark (no other chatter/marks whatsoever).  
Everything else is great:
-Wide Open Draw
-Crisp Edges
-Excellent Bowl interior and Drilling

This pipe has been fully cleaned and restored and will arrive at your door ready to smoke and enjoy.

name: Vintage JOST Supreme Meerschaum-Lined Algerian Briar Prince Estate Pipe
description:
This pipe bums me out, man.  
Somewhere in the cleaning process, the slight spider webbing on the front of the bowl interior, gave way to a couple of small chunks of the meerschaum flaking out.

It's still going to be a great pipe for someone, but it will need to be someone who knows how to apply ash or patch treatments to the bowl interior.

Everything else you can see.  Fantastic Straight Grain all around the bowl with a beautiful Birdseye heel.  The stem has a couple of tooth marks and a hairline crack on the very end of the bit that's not going any further.

name: 1960's Imperial Old Bruyere 124 Canadian Estate Pipe
description:
If you're looking for a budget Group 3 or so Canadian that's in great condition, look no further.

A bit of research on the lineage of Imperial Pipes yielded nothing conclusive.  I finally gave up.  If you know anything, please share.  

From what I can see though, you're getting a quality pipe that's very similar to what you would get in a Comoy's Everyman or Guildhall.  A well-constructed pipe with a wide open draw, nice grain, and a couple of small fills.  No tooth marks on the stem.  Great bowl interior and drilling.

The small green/brown patch on top of the stem came from not wanting to buff out the original Imperial nomenclature.  There is a bit of carbon on the rim that I'll leave for you to take care of in the down times on that fishing trip you've got coming up.

description:
I've always liked the Savinelli Estella pipes, mostly because I've never had one that didn't smoke well.  That's true of most Savinelli pipes I've had.  But rarely have they been this big.  This pipe is very pleasing to hold in the hand, thanks to the marvelous Estella Rustication.  

It also feels lighter than it should, but please, don't go trying to clench it.  Still much too big for that.

name: Sweet and Stylish Viking Pipe Club of Saint Louis T-Shirt
description:
We here at Viking Club Pipes share a logo with the Viking Pipe Club of Saint Louis.  Now you can share our style with the rest of the world, while supporting the Viking Pipe Club and Pipe Smokers everywhere.

All T-Shirts are Gray with Dark Green Ink.  These shirts are quality and very soft.  The shirts are American Apparel brand, which are my favorite.  As you can see, the logo rules.

Available in Large and X-tra Large

name: BIG Wooden Tobacco Jar**All wood construction**Lined with Cork
description:
This is a large wooden tobacco jar that smells absolutely lovely as it was used for decades for storing about a pound of tobacco.

The level of detail is pretty great and you can see some of the designs.  The interior appears to be lined with cork and the bottom is coated with felt.

name: Vintag Prince Albert Tobacco Jar**Lid says 14 oz.
description:
This Prince Albert Jar is in great condition and looks really cool.  
It will hold nearly a pound of your favorite tobacco.

No cracks or dents.  What you see is what you get.

I have no idea how old it is, but I would imagine it's pre-1950's from the collection it came with.  It definitely pre-dates any sort of foolish warning about your imminent death if you smoke it.

name: Pre-War JOBEY Hand Rubbed Square Shank 440 Billiard *Made in England *Hand Cut Stem
description:
From everything I can tell, these old Jobey pipes were Fantastic.  This one has really nice grain with no fills and a hand-cut stem.  All of the edges are still crisp, and it is in Excellent Condition.  I'm not exactly sure what the "Hand Rubbed" stamp means, but what's life without a bit of mystery?

If no one jumps on this, I might add it to the collection.
-Wide Open Draw
-No tooth marks on the Original, Hand Cut Stem
-Sits up nicely
-Excellent condition with only a couple of minor exterior surface dings.
-Drilling and Bowl Interior are Excellent.
-Solid Group 4 Size
-Fully cleaned, restored, and ready to enjoy!

description:
If you've got the time, I've got the pipe.
This Big and Beautiful Lane Era Charatan might just be the perfect pipe for several of you, if you like em big, like  2-3 Hour Smoke, Big.

It certainly is a classic.  The old Charatan pipes like this guy have some amazing character in the blasts and in the shaping, and this is no exception.  The walls are about 1/3" thick, for a cool smoke.  This pipe has been broken in, but was fully restored, with the chamber cleaned all the way down to the briar.  

The bowl interior is EXCELLENT, with no pits or over-reaming, and the Drilling is PERFECTLY SPOT-ON the bottom of the bowl.  The Draw is WIDE OPEN with the original Double-Comfort Stem fitting perfectly.  It is nice and flat and comfy, with no tooth marks whatsoever.

My, Oh My, the old carvers at Sasieni sure did know how to rusticate a pipe!  This Danzey would have been produced in the late 1940's or early 1950's, because there's no Pat. No., but it still has the smaller dot pattern and the football-shaped MADE IN ENGLAND stamping.

description:
The Dunhill Redbark finish was introduced in 1972, making this year of redbark pipe the Rookie Card of Dunhill Redbarks.

I would totally insist this was a Rookie Dunhill, if it had never been smoked, but this one certainly hasn't been smoked much.  Just look at the crisp edges around the rim!

Lots of beautiful character in the blasted grain here.  The weight to bowl capacity ratio is really great here.  Nice and light, but will smoke for a good 90 minutes.  Sits up nicely as well!

name: 1960's GBD New Era D 584 Bent Bulldog Estate Pipe *This is the Squared-off 9438
description:
The GBD 9438 Bent Rhodesian has been all the rage for the last few years, and that's cool.  I've had a few and they are nice.  But I'm willing to bet that before the Rhodesian usurper, there was the Bent Bulldog--solid and dependable and feeling great in the hand, but ready to hang from the mouth for a while if need be as well.

What I really like about this 584 is the Chubby look to it. It has something to do with the way GBD does the bowl/shank transitions on their bent bulldogs and rhodesians, as well as the slope of the front face.  

In any case, this Bent Bulldog stands proud, ready to do its level best for you.  
-Wide Open Draw
-Excellent Condition all around.
-No tooth marks whatsoever on the original vulcanite stem
-Passes the cleaner test, but maybe not with a big, fluffy cleaner.
-Excellent Bowl interior and perfect drilling.

Fully cleaned and restored and ready to smoke and enjoy!!

name: Vintage 1960's COMOY'S Tradition 5 Bulldog Estate Pipe w Awesome Birdseye and in Excellent Condition
description:
This pipe is Magnificent!  They say that no one carved the Classic British shapes more classically than the House of Comoy, and here I have to agree with "They".  Perfect, Masculine lines from front to back, with just the slightest forward cant to the bowl.  Big for a Comoy, too.  A Group 5 in size.

I have to also note that the grain here is much better than I've ever seen on a Tradition before.  This is a lighter stain that is easily 2/3 Birdseye and the rest Cross and Flame Grain. I've never seen any fills on a Tradition, and this one has none either.

This pipe was well-cared for by the previous owner and has been fully cleaned and restored.  You will not be disappointed.
-Wide Open Draw
-No tooth marks whatsoever on the 3-part-C-stem.
-Excellent Rim, and Bowl Interior w/ Perfect Drilling.
-Passes the Cleaner Test.

name: Vintage 1960's COMOY'S London Pride 363 Panel Billiard Estate Pipe
description:
Of all the old Comoy finishes, I think I like the London Pride the best, because of it's natural Amber coloring, and the fact that they tend to be Birdsey/Cross-Grained pattern pipes. 

What a great pipe! This 4-Panel Billiard with the Square shank is another Classic British shape from the House of Comoy.  This is just Beautifully carved.  Also note that the Birdseye covers the side-panels, while diagonal flame/cross-grain runs up the fore and aft. Well Done, Comoy!!
This is another that will surely be in my collection if not sold by Christmas.  A nice bowl capacity, but weighs in at only 30 grams!

name: Sweet Vintage Lorenzo Churchwarden Sitter Cha Cha Estate Pipe**Barely Smoked
description:
Although this pipe's only nomenclature is "ITALY", I have sold a few of these Lorenzo churchwardens with the crazy stems, and I know that they are made by Lorenzo.  One of them was sold to one of my best friends, and he maintains it is one of his best pipes.

At some point over at Lorenzo, someone said "Alright guys, let's invent a Churchwarden that hangs perfectly from the mouth, and also sits up.  We shall call it: Cha Cha."  And despite its unfortunate name, I really like the end product.  
-Open Draw, but not wide open.
-Perfect Drilling and Bowl Interior w Crisp Edges
-Barely smoked

description:
Go to Trevor's site and read the story about how he found these Oooooold pre-shaped stummels in a barn in France.  For a while now he has been finishing them into what many consider to be the best value available for new pipes in the world today.  So light and beautiful, and they are SUPERB smokers.  

Six months from now I'm going to be very angry that I sold this one, but we can really use the money with a baby on the way.

-This pipe is very light and has always been a fantastic smoker for me.
-Awesome, detailed blast.
-Wide Open Draw.
-Still has very crisp edges. 
-Usually smoked with fine Virginia and VaPer tobaccos.
-Comfy, flat, wide vulcanite stem.
-a very small amount of minor chatter, but no tooth impressions on the original stem.
-will come with the original Ligne Bretagne Green Velvet bag.

name: UNSMOKED TODD JOHNSON Flame Grain Hawkbill Pipe * HUGE and Perfect* Over 7" long
description:
Todd Johnson took the pipe world by storm for the past decade or so.  For being an American carver, his ideas are all his own and he thinks very outside the box.  One thing he is not known to compromise on is the perfection of his pipes, and you can see that in this HUGE Hawkbill.

This pipe is beautiful and perfect. Flame Grain all around with Beautiful Birdseye covering the bottom.  Though the chamber is perfectly round, the bowl itself is oblong, making it deliciously comfortable to hold.  

The stem is a very attractive bakelite or lucite and is exceedingly comfortable, even though it would be madness to try and clench this massive briar.

You will congratulate yourself over and over for owning this pipe.  Enjoy!

Comes with original bag.  If you need additional pictures, please email me.
Shipping is higher on this one, due to insurance, etc.

name: Stunning 1990 ASHTON Sovereign LX Poker with Silver Rim
description:
This is one of the best looking pipes I've ever had the pleasure of selling.
From what I've heard, the late 80's and early 90's were Bill Taylor's sweet spot of making quality Ashton pipes.  This one is making a believer out of me.

This is a BIG and BEAUTIFUL Pipe. If you need me to send you more pictures of that grain, just say the word and I will.  The chamber is big enough for me to insert my thumb and freely twirl it around.  Should be a 2-3 hour smoker.

The walls are about 1/3 of an inch thick and although the Silver Rim is huge, the briar itself feels light.  From everything I understand about Ashton's Oil Curing and Taylor's reputation and methods, this is going to be a fantastic smoker.  

This pipe deserves to be the centerpiece in any English Pipe collection or Poker Collection.
This pipe has been fully restored and will arrive at your door ready to smoke and enjoy.

name: Bentley by Former Swiss Made Blasted Bent Billiard Estate Pipe*Nearly Unsmoked
description:
The sun shines on a dog's butt some days.  Today it is yours.

Former, master pipe maker extraordinaire,  decided in the early 80's to branch out on his own in the more "budget" pipe line with these Bentley pipes.  They retailed for $175-$275, depending on the fit and finish. 
I picked this pipe up a while ago, but have barely gotten around to smoking it. Here's what separates this one from most that I've seen:
1.  It is nearly unsmoked.  5x at the most
2.  It is traditionally engineered and DOES NOT accept a 9mm filter, as most of these Bentley pipes did.
3.  The grain and blast is tremendous and shows great character (see pics)
4.  The stem is Hand-Cut Ebonite
5.  This is an early SWISS model, before the plant was moved to Germany and quality declined.

Copy this link to your browser to learn more about Bentley pipes and Former:
http://pipedia.org/index.php?title=Former

name: Svendborg Danish Rhodesian*Inka Barkennine Hand Made Estate Pipe
description:
Svendborg was started by Tao Nielsen and Poul Ilsted back in the day and their influence clearly shows in the lines of their pipes. Every Svendborg I've seen is a very cool take on the classic pipe shapes, and this one is no exception.

This is their version of the slightly bent, chubby Rhodesian.  I'm a fan of these shapes in general, but again, Svendborg just does it right here.  Great lines and a WIDE OPEN draw.  This is going to be a fantastic smoker!
